messages: 320325ac497ba00e9b23811edfda82f0 (02:16): lmao... vasiliyb was right, and Andrei is wrong... not sure about Muisje
320325ac497ba00e9b23811edfda82f0 (02:18): For the record, INT(x), the x is for ZEROFILL only. It means how many zeros to pad. Does not limit the range of the numeric column.  RTM.
320325ac497ba00e9b23811edfda82f0 (02:19): Muisje: "<Muisje> It will increase the max range, but you could never save it in there" <-- I'm not sure.
424114ac0489dbaa788c6c4849fc33fb (02:19): If you have an int of 2
424114ac0489dbaa788c6c4849fc33fb (02:19): the max range will be 0 to 99
424114ac0489dbaa788c6c4849fc33fb (02:20): But then you would need to increase the max int length
4d6fad18f5905dd3f0489d69385c7be8 (02:20): the number in the parens has _nothing_ to do with the values that can be stored
320325ac497ba00e9b23811edfda82f0 (02:20): You CANNOT in any way change the range.
320325ac497ba00e9b23811edfda82f0 (02:20): You cannot change the range, length, or anything about INT. You can only tell how many zeros for MySQL to "fill in"
4d6fad18f5905dd3f0489d69385c7be8 (02:21): that was one of the first blog entries I ever wrote
424114ac0489dbaa788c6c4849fc33fb (02:21): will_ i have never seen an INT(5) contain 6 characters.
424114ac0489dbaa788c6c4849fc33fb (02:22): I get the things done i want the way i do it.
320325ac497ba00e9b23811edfda82f0 (02:23): You should care, especially if you are telling other people.
424114ac0489dbaa788c6c4849fc33fb (02:23): Luckily for those people, there are people like you who keep correcting me then ;)
320325ac497ba00e9b23811edfda82f0 (02:24): Because I'm a jerk. asshole, etc.
424114ac0489dbaa788c6c4849fc33fb (02:24): Because i don't want to listen what he is saying at the moment?
4d6fad18f5905dd3f0489d69385c7be8 (02:24): I try not to ignore people that give me useful information
424114ac0489dbaa788c6c4849fc33fb (02:24): Wether or not he is right
424114ac0489dbaa788c6c4849fc33fb (02:25): It will not make any difference.
424114ac0489dbaa788c6c4849fc33fb (02:25): He's ignored for a hour, by then he assumingly dropped the subject.
320325ac497ba00e9b23811edfda82f0 (02:29): firewire: Do you still referrer people to that blog entry?
4d6fad18f5905dd3f0489d69385c7be8 (02:30): that one and the select * is bad karma one
320325ac497ba00e9b23811edfda82f0 (02:30): firewire: I think it would help if you showed an example of inserting a larger 999 example in the INT(3)
320325ac497ba00e9b23811edfda82f0 (02:31): Show how INT(3) does not limit adding in 1000
9ce30ddf0128522375f75b49afaffeee (02:31): INT(X) does not restrict the stored data to X digits, it only padds it to X digits if ZEROFILL is on
320325ac497ba00e9b23811edfda82f0 (02:32): If you have an int of 2
320325ac497ba00e9b23811edfda82f0 (02:32): the max range will be 0 to 99
9ce30ddf0128522375f75b49afaffeee (02:33): will_: that's not true at all
320325ac497ba00e9b23811edfda82f0 (02:33): Jivedue: I'm going to put you on my ignore list now.
9ce30ddf0128522375f75b49afaffeee (02:34): will_: then it will be like you're ignoring the truth for an hour
9ce30ddf0128522375f75b49afaffeee (02:34): will_: have fun with your incorrect knowledge

45bc2a483083e777c7e78e739c4a060c (02:35): From the manual:  Another extension is supported by MySQL for optionally specifying the display width of an integer value in parentheses following the base keyword for the type (for example, INT(4)). This optional display width specification is used to left-pad the display of values having a width less than the width specified for the column.

45bc2a483083e777c7e78e739c4a060c (02:35): The display width does not constrain the range of values that can be stored in the column, nor the number of digits that are displayed for values having a width exceeding that specified for the column.
9ce30ddf0128522375f75b49afaffeee (02:35): will just made a fool of himself.
d99b1bb9dc35b174cbab54bcf7195bdc (02:35): That quote is exactly what will was saying.
320325ac497ba00e9b23811edfda82f0 (02:36): Maybe I take jokes too far sometimes.
